_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 16:42:26 using v2.1
title: How have perceptions of outpatient toilets cleanliness changed?
analysis_commentary: On the whole, patients' opinions on the cleanliness of outpatient toilets are not as good as of those on outpatient departments. However, similar to the views on the department, the majority of patients surveyed in 2011 report that in their opinion the outpatient toilets were either 'very clean' or 'fairly clean' (95%) and 2011 saw the largest percentage of patients saying that they found the outpatient toilets 'very clean' (60%) over all the surveys.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
